content: In this dataset, people are asked how polite they believe the text to be. 0 means polite, while 25 is impolite. Examples from the dataset (there may not be any):Examples from the dataset (there may not be any) Example 1: Text: The has a request (header "") left a few hours ago by someone who has pictures of signs in China but can't read them. Would you please be willing to help? Annotation from annotator: 13 Example 2: Text: May I say it this way: ''Even if the car always is known to be behind the same door,'' but if you make your decision "at random", ''even then'' your chance is 2/3 to have picked a goat. Okay? Annotation from annotator: 9 Example 3: Text: Well, actually I wanted to know if there were any errors in my own maps. ;) Anyway, is the new map at better? Annotation from annotator: 15 Example 4: Text: Understood. Do you know of any legal expert you could contact to clarify this issue? Annotation from annotator: 14 Example 5: Text: Well, I haven't seen a lot there, but the pages that I've seen were sourced. Does this mean you consider a sourced article in Wikipedia also unreliable? Annotation from annotator: 14 Example 6: Text: E-mail me at (just get rid of the spaces in between the letters and numbers) whenever you feel like it. By the way are you a member on any Iranian football forums online? Annotation from annotator: 17 Example 7: Text: Also, 'topological proof'? Isn't 'proof' a bit strong? Annotation from annotator: 7 Example 8: Text: Lists like this are a bad idea to begin with, and this one in particular has been deleted via an AfD. Why not try categories instead? Annotation from annotator: 10 Example 9: Text: I noticed that the A team article for Australia is at instead of . Is that intentional, or something we should fix with a page move? Annotation from annotator: 15 Example 10: Text: You're welcome to revert edits, but I'm puzzled as to why you reverted this one - it seems absolutely essential to me the give a summary of Genesis 1. And if you revert Gen1, why leave Gen2? Annotation from annotator: 7 Example 11: Text: I have indicated on that, should you be desyopped, I will immediately re-nominate you for sysop. Would you accept the nomination if I did? Annotation from annotator: 14 Example 12: Text: Well... actually it is . Could it be visible? Annotation from annotator: 17 Example 13: Text: , with whom you discussed linkspam in 2006, has returned. Could you offer your views on his talkpage? Annotation from annotator: 14 Example 14: Text: User 86.138.232.97 does have a history of malicous edits. Are you then confirming that these malicious edits done by user 86.138.232.97 were done by yourself? Annotation from annotator: 9 Example 15: Text: My concern about the article above still stands (re: notability). Now that it has been unmerged (against the AfD), will it be merged into the Begin articles as suggested, or will it have to be renominated? Annotation from annotator: 14 Example 16: Text: I'm a little surprised you haven't responded to my suggestions regarding the GAN yet. Is there some sort of a problem there, or have you just not managed to get around to it yet? Annotation from annotator: 7 Example 17: Text: I'm sure that this is not a useful place to discuss the merits of your topic ban, which I think would need a wider audience to overturn. Perhaps you could make a request to the arbitration committee? Annotation from annotator: 12 Example 18: Text: I personally cannot see why it is justified, well not from a quick perusal of his edit history anyway. Can you explain please? Annotation from annotator: 10 Example 19: Text: I vote that they stay, given that even though they're not "Recurring" in and of themselves, they're part of a recurring phenomenon, which is Stephen doing "Better Know a District" spin-offs. So, maybe we should re-group them under a heading of "Spin-Offs" in the "BKaD" section? Annotation from annotator: 14 Example 20: Text: I'm always happy to give a second opinion on ID - you're welcome to put images on my talk page to discuss them. Regarding , I would tend to go with '''', what do you think? Annotation from annotator: 15 Example 21: Text: Actually, I am concerned that you had completely removed verifiable facts of which I had included the references. Would you please explain why you had removed the entire section I wrote on Collection Agencies in Canada? Annotation from annotator: 7 Example 22: Text: Hi Kathleen - It looks OK to me; all I did was change the template wording a bit and add parent cats to the stub category. What problem were you having? Annotation from annotator: 10 Example 23: Text: Please stop removing properly referenced information that I have added to this article. This is an article that YOU nominated for deletion, so why are you even editing it? Annotation from annotator: 7 Example 24: Text: Which of course is all the more ironic as my initial edits were an attempt to ''improve'' the article per . Who the hell would have predicted all this? Annotation from annotator: 6 Example 25: Text: Wow, thanks for pointing that out. I'm having a bad night, and all the theading... anyway, did I get them all? Annotation from annotator: 16 Example 26: Text: Hm. Are you asking to be banned? Annotation from annotator: 7 Example 27: Text: I would specifically appreciate an outside view at the thread . What do you feel is the appropriate action? Annotation from annotator: 15 Example 28: Text: I see you created a nonsense article yesterday because you were bored. If I unblock you will you disrupt more? Annotation from annotator: 5 Example 29: Text: Hey. I'm proposing a - would you be interested in coming along? Annotation from annotator: 18 Example 30: Text: BTW, I'm amazed that he has the gumption to show his mug after . And do you have the balls (metaphorically or otherwise) to place a hatnote above his article linking to that term? Annotation from annotator: 9 Target Example: Text: Hi, do you mind if I move your hook to go live on 26/27th? The GLAM WIKI conference could do with being highlighed by a non US/UK hook? Annotation from annotator: Your output should be a single integer and nothing else.
